metadata.Title: CVE-2023-35838 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium.
metadata.Description: The WireGuard client 0.5.3 on Windows insecurely configures the operating system and firewall such that traffic to a local network that uses non-RFC1918 IP addresses is blocked. This allows an adversary to trick the victim into blocking IP traffic to selected IP addresses and services even while the VPN is enabled. NOTE: the tunnelcrack.mathyvanhoef.com website uses this CVE ID to refer more generally to "LocalNet attack resulting in the blocking of traffic" rather than to only WireGuard.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> other VPN software may also be affected. See whitepaper for the complete list.

criterions.comment: wireguard: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
